message.content: This question requires basic knowledge of temperature and heating. Option (A), steaming coffee, is likely to be hotter because it is actively emitting steam, indicating that it has been heated. Option (B), the ocean, and Option (C), the forest, are not inherently hotter as they do not indicate temperature. Option (D), tepid water, refers to water that is neither hot nor cold, so it is not likely to be hotter.

This question requires basic knowledge about temperature. Steaming coffee is likely to be hotter compared to the other options. When coffee is steaming, it is emitting heat, indicating a higher temperature. Option (B), the ocean, may not be hot as a whole, although some regions might be warm, but it is generally not as hot as steaming coffee. Option (C), the forest, may be warm due to sunlight and humidity, but it is not necessarily hotter than steaming coffee. Option (D), tepid water, refers to water that is neither hot nor cold, so it is not as hot as steaming coffee.
